alert.note: Alert for Hot Spring (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 06 at 3:01PM CDT until September 06 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL CLARK AND WEST CENTRAL HOT SPRING COUNTIES... At 259 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over DeGray Lake State Park, or 8 miles northwest of Arkadelphia, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... DeGray Lake State Park... HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. If on or near DeGray Lake, get away from the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. remember, lightning can strike out to 15 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
